subhead: The attacks mark the first by US forces in Nigeria under Trump, and come after the Republican berated the West African nation in October and November, saying Christians there faced an 'existential threat' that amounted to 'genocide' amid Nigeria's myriad armed conflicts.

Europe's relentless semiconductor decline
subhead: 'Chips: The Oil of the 21st Century' (3/5). When the Chips Act, the plan by the 27 European Union member states to reduce their dependence on the US and China for semiconductors, came into force in 2023, the goal initially appeared 'out of reach.'

title: 'Tyranny is booming': Kimmel warns of rising fascism in Christmas message to UK viewers
subhead: The talk show host took aim at US President Donald Trump in a message aired on Channel 4 on Thursday, dubbed 'The Alternative Christmas Message.' Kimmel appealed to Britons not to give up on Americans.

title: Pop goes the cocktail! Five champagne cocktail recipes for the end-of-year festivities
subhead: While the idea may offend some purists, champagne features prominently in many cocktail recipes. Five bartenders share their personal creations, all featuring prestigious and sublime bubbly.

title: Escaping New York's winter and its 'communist' mayor for Miami
subhead: 'My Christmas under Trump' (4/5). Journalist Georgia Husson settled in New York right in the middle of the holiday season preparations. Just a few hours' flight from the Big Apple, the state draws wealthy New Yorkers in search of sunshine, peace and quiet and extravagant gifts.

Why more young people are turning to religion
subhead: Many researchers have observed a resurgence of religious commitment among young people in France, often accompanied by a certain rigorism. This renewed spiritual quest is linked both to the anxieties of our era and, at times, a search for identity.

title: Is Paris finally embracing musical theater?
subhead: Long considered unpopular by the French, musicals have flourished recently in the capital. But is this just a mere trend to which the French will inevitably turn their noses up?

title: White, snowy Christmas: The truth behind a misleading cliché
subhead: Long associated with imagery of the Three Wise Men, the depiction of Christmas took on a wintry turn in the 16th century. Yet the chances of seeing snow in France on December 25 have never been lower.
